intro: Cynoglossum columnae, commonly known as the columnar forget-me-not, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its upright, columnar growth habit and produces small, blue or violet flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has hairy, lance-shaped leaves that are arranged oppositely along the stem. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a hardy perennial suitable for rock gardens and alpine settings. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its delicate flowers and compact form.
